sentences.en: Be indulgent it is sincere in the main.
sentences.cn: 请宽慰吧,我这席话基本上是诚恳的.

sentences.en: He is indulgent towards his pupils.
He was rather too indulgent in humouring her caprices.
sentences.cn: 讲到容忍她的反复无常,他实在是太迁就了.

sentences.en: Hurstwood smiled in an indulgent way as he read this letter.
sentences.cn: 赫斯渥看了信,不觉得意洋洋地笑了出来.

sentences.en: In their chastened smile is an indulgent mockery.
sentences.cn: 他们的莞尔微笑中流露着一种宽容的讥诮.

sentences.en: Mr. Green is indulgent of others'shortcomings.
sentences.cn: 格林先生对他人的缺点总是宽大为怀.

sentences.en: She is indulgent to her grandchildren.
To buy flowers for myself seems wildly self-indulgent.
sentences.cn: 为自己买花似乎太放纵自己了。

sentences.en: to take an indulgent view of sth
toys bought by their indulgent grandparents
sentences.cn: 溺爱孩子的(外)祖父母买的玩具

sentences.en: We shouldn't be indulgent towards his mistakes.
Why give publicity to this self-indulgent, adolescent oaf?
sentences.cn: 为什么要宣传报道这个行为任性、青春期未满的白痴呢？

sentences.en: You are too indulgent with your children.
You're ruining that child, eg by being too indulgent.
Zhou, who had first put that idea forward, hid his boredom behind an indulgent smile.
sentences.cn: 最早提出这个概念的周以宽容的微笑掩盖了他的厌烦.

trans.tran_cn: 放纵的，纵容的，宽容的，任性的
trans.tran_en: willing to allow someone, especially a child, to do or have whatever they want, even if this is not good for them
